FuncDef: The check version ap-id command checks the versions of components in the current router.

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates the ID of the AP device.
The value is an integer ranging from 1024 to 8191.

Specifies the name of the system software stored in the CF card.
The value is a string of 4 to 127 characters, spaces not supported.

Upgrades the Router to the current startup system software.
-

Examples: Info: Prepare to check system software cfcard:/xxxx.cc, please wait ..................................................
Info: System software signature check passed!
Slot #     Type Content              CurVer  ExactVer  State        Upgrade Suggestion
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The check version ap-id command checks the versions of components in the current router. If the State is a component of Incompatible, separate upgrading is needed.
Precautions
In VS mode, this command is supported only by the admin VS.
When an online user is performing upgrade or checking versions, other users cannot check versions.
